modules.name: cbr
modules.description: This module can be used to provision and configure Context Based Restrictions.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module can be used to provision and configure [Context Based Restrictions](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/account?topic=account-context-restrictions-create&interface=ui).

modules.name: resource-group
modules.description: Looks up or creates an IBM Cloud resource group by name
modules.readme_excerpt: This module returns the ID for the name of a resource group. It can also create a group from a name and return the ID. The module will return the ID of the default resource group if no name is passed, or if the string "Default" or "default" is passed (even if that is not the name of the actual default resource group in the account).

modules.name: cos
modules.description: Configures an IBM Cloud Object Storage instance and bucket
modules.readme_excerpt: Use this module to provision and configure an IBM [Cloud Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-getting-started-cloud-object-storage) instance and bucket.

modules.name: kms-key
modules.description: Module for creation of KMS keys
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports creating a standard or root key in an existing key ring and KMS instance. KMS can be Key Protect or Hyper Protect Crypto Services (HPCS) Standard plan instance. You can specify rotation and deletion policies for the keys.

modules.name: kms-key-ring
modules.description: Module to create Key Rings in a KMS instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates a key ring to help organize keys in a KMS instance. KMS can be Key Protect or Hyper Protect Crypto Services(HPCS) instance.

modules.name: key-protect
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM Key Protect
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports: Creating a Key Protect instance, Enabling a rotation policy for the instance, Enabling a dual authorization policy for the instance, Enabling a metrics policy for the instance, Enabling a key create and import access policy for the instance

modules.name: kms-all-inclusive
modules.description: Supports creating a Key Protect instance, KMS Key Rings and Keys.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module combines the following key management service (KMS) modules to create a full end-to-end key infrastructure: Key Protect module, KMS Key module, KMS Key Ring module

modules.name: secrets-manager-secret-group
modules.description: Creates a secret group in an IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates a secret group in an IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance. For more information, see [Best practices for organizing secrets and assigning access](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-best-practices-organize-secrets#best-practices-secret-groups).

modules.name: security-group
modules.description: Creates a security group with the option to add rules for internal IBM Cloud flows
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports most operations on security groups for VPC. For more information, see [About security groups](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-using-security-groups) in the IBM Cloud Docs.

modules.name: landing-zone-vpc
modules.description: This module creates the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) resources in a cloud environment, including subnets and security groups. Also Supports floating IP addresses and multiple load balancers.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates the following IBM Cloud Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network components: VPC, Public gateways, Subnets, Network ACLs, VPN gateways, and more

modules.name: secrets-manager-secret
modules.description: Creates secrets in a Secrets Manager instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates a secret in an IBM Secrets Manager secrets group.

modules.name: base-ocp-vpc
modules.description: Provisions a Red Hat OpenShift VPC cluster on IBM Cloud
modules.readme_excerpt: Use this module to provision an [IBM Cloud Red Hat OpenShift cluster](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-getting-started) on VPC Gen2. The module either creates the required Cloud Object Storage instance or uses an existing instance. The module also supports optionally passing a key management configuration for secret encryption and boot volume encryption.

modules.name: landing-zone-vsi
modules.description: Creates Virtual Server Instances (VSI) across multiple subnets with any number of block storage volumes that are connected by any number of load balancers
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates Virtual Server Instances (VSI) across multiple subnets with any number of block storage volumes that are connected by any number of load balancers.

modules.name: secrets-manager
modules.description: This module creates a Secrets Manager instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module is used to provision and configure an IBM Cloud [Secrets Manager](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-getting-started) instance.

modules.name: iam-access-group
modules.description: This module is used to create an acess group, adding members to access group, defining the acces group policy and adding dynamic rules to access group.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module is used to create an acess group, adding members to access group, defining the acces group policy and adding dynamic rules to access group. Access groups can be used to define a set of permissions that you want to grant to a group of users. terraform-ibm-iam-access-group, Submodules, access-management, Examples, Access Management example, and more

modules.name: secrets-manager-private-cert-engine
modules.description: Creates a private certificates engine in a Secrets Manager instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module configures a private certificates engine for a Secrets Manager instance. For more information about enabling Secrets Manager for private certificates, see [Preparing to create private certificates](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-prepare-order-certificates).

modules.name: observability-agents
modules.description: Deploys the Log Analysis agent and Cloud Monitoring agents to a cluster
modules.readme_excerpt: :warning: **Deprecated**: This module has been deprecated in favour of the following 2 modules: terraform-ibm-monitoring-agent, terraform-ibm-logs-agent

modules.name: secrets-manager-private-cert
modules.description: Orders a private certificate secret in a Secrets Manager instance that has the private certificates engine configured
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates a private certificate in an existing Secrets Manager instance that has a configured [Private Certificate Engine](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-certificates&interface=ui).

modules.name: scc-workload-protection
modules.description: Module that supports provisioning a Security and Compliance Center Workload Protection instance
modules.readme_excerpt: A module for provisioning an [IBM Cloud Security and Compliance Center Workload Protection instance](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/workload-protection?topic=workload-protection-getting-started). The module will always create a Manager resource key that connects to the SCC WP instance.

modules.name: client-to-site-vpn
modules.description: Creates a client-to-site VPN gateway in a VPC
modules.readme_excerpt: This module automates the provisioning of a client-to-site VPN in a VPC cluster. For more information, see [About client-to-site VPN servers](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-vpn-client-to-site-overview) in the IBM Cloud docs.

modules.name: event-notifications
modules.description: A module for creating IBM Cloud Event Notifications
modules.readme_excerpt: This module is used to create an IBM Cloud Event Notifications instance to filter and route event notifications from IBM Cloud services like monitoring, to communication channels like email, SMS, and webhooks. Event Notifications provides you information about critical events that occur in your IBM Cloud account or triggers automated actions by using webhooks. For more information, see [Getting started with Event Notifications](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/event-notifications?topic=event-notifications-getting-started).

modules.name: secrets-manager-public-cert-engine
modules.description: Creates a public certificates engine in a Secrets Manager instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module configures a public certificates engine for a Secrets Manager instance. For more information about enabling Secrets Manager for public certificates, see [Preparing to order public certificates](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-prepare-order-certificates).

modules.name: powervs-workspace
modules.description: Sets up and configures a Power Virtual Servers workspace and optionally connects it to existing transit gateway
modules.readme_excerpt: This root module automates and provisions a IBM Power Virtual Server Workspace with following components: Creates an IBM Power Virtual Server (PowerVS) workspace., Creates an SSH key., Optionally imports up to three custom images from Cloud Object Storage., Optionally create one or two or three private subnets., Optionally create one public subnet., and more

modules.name: vpe-gateway
modules.description: Create Virtual Private Endpoint Gateways across VPC subnets.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates and configures virtual private endpoint gateways (https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-ordering-endpoint-gateway) for an IBM Cloud service.

modules.name: vpc
modules.description: Provisions and configures IBM Cloud VPC resources
modules.readme_excerpt: This module provides a comprehensive solution for managing IBM Cloud Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) infrastructure. It includes a main module and several submodules, enabling you to create, configure, and manage VPC components either individually or through the main module.

modules.name: powervs-instance
modules.description: Creates and configures Power Virtual Server instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This root module automates and provisions an IBM Power Virtual Server instance with following components: Creates an IBM Power Virtual Server Instance., Attaches **existing private subnets** to the instance., Optionally creates volumes and attaches it to the instance., Optionally attaches existing volume ids to the instance.

modules.name: iam-account-settings
modules.description: Configures standard IAM parameters and account settings
modules.readme_excerpt: This module configures standard IAM account settings with the recommended values, in which the default values are

modules.name: cloud-logs
modules.description: This module supports configuring an IBM Cloud Logs instance, log routing tenants to enable platform logs and cloud logs policies.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports configuring an IBM Cloud Logs instance, log routing tenants to enable platform logs and cloud logs policies.

modules.name: cloud-monitoring
modules.description: This module supports configuring an IBM Cloud Monitoring instance and IBM Cloud Metrics Routing.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports configuring an IBM Cloud Monitoring instance, metrics routing target, routes and settings.

modules.name: code-engine
modules.description: Provisions and configures IBM Cloud Code Engine.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module provisions the IBM Cloud Code Engine fully managed and serverless platform. It supports deployment of containerized workloads, including web apps, batch jobs, builds, config maps, bindings, domain mappings, or secrets. For more information, see [About Code Engine](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/codeengine?topic=codeengine-getting-started)

modules.name: dedicated-host
modules.description: This module provisions dedicated hosts and dedicated host groups, which are designed to provide total isolation, control, and security for your heavy, mission-critical workloads.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module used to provision dedicated Host which is a fully dedicated, single-tenant physical server hosted in IBM Cloud data centers. It is designed for enterprises that require strict isolation of workloads, enhanced security, and consistent performance. With a dedicated host, customers have full control over server allocation, resource usage, and compliance requirements while leveraging the scalability and reliability of the IBM Cloud.

modules.name: icd-postgresql
modules.description: Implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for PostgreSQL service.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for PostgreSQL service.

modules.name: app-configuration
modules.description: Create an App Configuration instance and optionally allows for multiple App Configuration Collections to be created.
modules.readme_excerpt: Create an App Configuration instance and optionally allows for multiple App Configuration Collections to be created.

modules.name: icd-mysql
modules.description: Creates and configures an IBM Cloud Databases for MySQL instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for MySQL service.

modules.name: secrets-manager-public-cert
modules.description: Orders a public certificate secret in a Secrets Manager instance that has the public certificates engine configured
modules.readme_excerpt: This module orders a public certificate in an IBM Secrets Manager secrets group from an existing Secrets Manager instance that has a public certificate engine configured.

modules.name: transit-gateway
modules.description: Provisions IBM Cloud Transit Gateway in an IBM Cloud account.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module includes the `terraform-ibm-transit-gateway-action` [approval action submodule](terraform-ibm-transit-gateway-action/README.md) that supports approving or rejecting connection requests in cross-account VPC connections.

modules.name: activity-tracker
modules.description: This module supports provisioning an IBM Cloud Activity Tracker Event Routing target & routes
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports configuring an IBM Cloud Activity Tracker event routing target, routes and settings.

modules.name: bare-metal-vpc
modules.description: Configure a Bare Metal Server for VPC
modules.readme_excerpt: The IBM Cloud Bare Metal Server Deployment Module provisions IBM Cloud Bare Metal Servers for VPC in a flexible and scalable manner. It supports deploying single or multiple servers, dynamically distributing them across one or more subnets while ensuring each instance is uniquely named.

modules.name: event-streams
modules.description: Module that supports provisioning and configuring IBM Cloud Event Streams
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements IBM Event Streams for IBM Cloud with topics, partitions, throughput, storage size, cleanup policy, retention time, retention size, segment size, and schema.

modules.name: powervs-infrastructure
modules.description: Sets up and configures a ready-to-use Power Virtual Servers infrastructure with IBM Cloud landing zone.
modules.readme_excerpt: This repository contains deployable architecture solutions that help provision VPC landing zones, PowerVS workspaces, and interconnect them. The solutions are available in the IBM Cloud Catalog and can also be deployed without the catalog, except for the second solution below.

modules.name: icd-redis
modules.description: Implements an instance of IBM Cloud Databases for Redis.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of IBM Cloud Databases for Redis.

modules.name: iam-service-id
modules.description: Create an IAM service IDs and adds policies to them.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module is used to create a IAM service IDs and add policies to them. A service ID identifies a service or application similar to how a user ID identifies a user. Create service IDs to enable access to your IBM Cloud services by applications hosted both inside and outside of IBM Cloud.

modules.name: container-registry
modules.description: Implements IBM Container Registry namespace and retention policy
modules.readme_excerpt: You can use this module to provision and configure an [IBM Container Registry](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/Registry?topic=Registry-getting-started) namespace and optionally, a container registry retention policy.

modules.name: external-secrets-operator
modules.description: Synchronizes secrets between Secrets Manager and an IBM Cloud OpenShift cluster
modules.readme_excerpt: This module automates the installation and configuration of the [External Secrets Operator](https://external-secrets.io/) in a cluster.

modules.name: logs-agent
modules.description: Terraform module to deploy the IBM Cloud Logs Agent on a Cluster
modules.readme_excerpt: This module deploys the following logs agent to an IBM Cloud Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform or Kubernetes cluster: Logs agent

modules.name: monitoring-agent
modules.description: Deploys an agent to monitor metrics and security data on an IBM Cloud Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform or Kubernetes cluster.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports the provisioning of an agent to an IBM Cloud Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform or Kubernetes cluster. The agent can be configured for: Metrics monitoring with IBM Cloud Monitoring

modules.name: watsonx-ai
modules.description: Terraform module to create and configure watsonx.ai Project
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports the following: Provisions the following services, `watsonx.ai Studio` (formerly known as `Watson Studio`), `watsonx.ai Runtime` (formerly known as `Watson Machine Learning`), Creates a starter `watsonx.ai` project.

modules.name: icd-mongodb
modules.description: Module that provisions IBM Cloud Databases for MongoDB
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for MongoDB service.

modules.name: icd-elasticsearch
modules.description: Implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for Elasticsearch service.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Databases for Elasticsearch service.

modules.name: icd-rabbitmq
modules.description: Implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Messages for RabbitMQ.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module implements an instance of the IBM Cloud Messages for RabbitMQ service.

modules.name: cis
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with internet services on IBM Cloud
modules.readme_excerpt: This module provisions an IBM Cloud Internet Services (CIS) instance and configures domain to the CIS instance. The module includes the submodules to add the following features to a CIS instance.

modules.name: vpc-private-path
modules.description: Configure Private Path services to provide private connectivity for IBM Cloud and third-party services.
modules.readme_excerpt: For information, see "Module names and descriptions" at https://terraform-ibm-modules.github.io/documentation/#/implementation-guidelines?id=module-names-and-descriptions -->

modules.name: cloudant
modules.description: Deploys and configures an IBM Cloudant instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports provisioning a instance of the IBM Cloudant service. With a Lite plan, the instance is provisioned on a multi-tenant environment. With a standard plan, the instance can be provisioned either on a multi-tenant or on a dedicated environment. For more information, see [Plans and provisioning](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/Cloudant?topic=Cloudant-ibm-cloud-public).

modules.name: secrets-manager-custom-credentials-engine
modules.description: Creates a custom credentials engine in a Secrets Manager instance
modules.readme_excerpt: This module configures a custom credentials engine for a Secrets Manager instance. For more information about enabling Secrets Manager for custom credentials engine, see [Preparing to create custom credentials engine](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-custom-credentials-prepare).

modules.name: hpcs
modules.description: Create and configure an IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Crypto Services instance.
modules.readme_excerpt: You can use this module to provision an IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Crypto Services (HPCS) instance.

modules.name: catalog-management
modules.description: Automation to manage an IBM Cloud catalog
modules.readme_excerpt: Automation to manage an IBM Cloud catalog.

modules.name: site-to-site-vpn
modules.description: Automation for configuring site-to-site VPN gateways.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module automates the provisioning of a site-to-site VPN. For more information, see [About site-to-site VPN](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-using-vpn) in the IBM Cloud docs.

modules.name: appid
modules.description: Creates an IBM AppID instance.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module creates an IBM AppID instance and a resource key.

modules.name: watsonx-data
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM watsonx.data
modules.readme_excerpt: This module supports provisioning the following: Provisioning watsonx.data instance with a selectable service plan

modules.name: watsonx-orchestrate
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM watsonx Orchestrate.
modules.readme_excerpt: The IBM watsonx Orchestrate Terraform module is designed to automate the deployment and configuration of the IBM watsonx Orchestrate, a multi-tenant and cloud-native solution that is deployed as a managed software as a service (SaaS) or that you can install on premises.For more information visit [here](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/current)

modules.name: watsonx-assistant
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM watsonx Assistant.
modules.readme_excerpt: The IBM watsonx Assistant Terraform module is designed to automate the deployment and configuration of the IBM watsonx Assistant, a next-generation conversational AI solution.

modules.name: s2s-auth
modules.description: This module is to set up a list of s2s authorization policies, and cbr rules
modules.readme_excerpt: This module generates authorization policies and context-based restriction (CBR) rules to enable access and restrictions between a source service and a target service.

modules.name: watsonx-governance
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM watsonx.governance.
modules.readme_excerpt: The IBM watsonx.governance Terraform module is designed to automate the deployment and configuration of IBM watsonx.governance, which is a toolkit which seamlessly integrates with your existing systems to automate and accelerate responsible AI workflows to help save time, reduce costs and comply with regulations.

modules.name: enterprise
modules.description: Creates accounts and account-groups in an existing enterprise
modules.readme_excerpt: This is a collection of sub modules and which will take tree based enterprise inputs and create child accounts and account-groups in an enterprise * [dynamic_values](submodules/dynamic_values) * [enterprise_hierarchy](submodules/enterprise_hierarchy)

modules.name: account-infrastructure-base
modules.description: A general base layer module for setting up a newly provisioned account.
modules.readme_excerpt: This module is a general base layer module for setting up a newly provisioned account with a default provision of: Base Resource Group, IAM Account Settings, Trusted Profile + Access Group for Projects, CBR Rules + Zones

modules.name: watsonx-discovery
modules.description: Terraform module to create and work with IBM watson Discovery.
modules.readme_excerpt: The IBM Watson Discovery terraform module is designed to automate the deployment and configuration of IBM Watson Discovery,which is an intelligent document processing engine that helps to gain insights from complex business documents.
